subject: Data
title: Your Health Data: Who Sees It?
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Your Health Data: Who Sees It?.

hook.text: A fitness app knows your heart rate, sleep patterns, and menstrual cycle. It's not covered by medical privacy laws.

buildup.text: HIPAA protects data at hospitals and insurers, but fitness apps, DNA tests, and wellness platforms are exempt.

discovery.text: Period-tracking apps were subpoenaed after Roe v. Wade was overturned, revealing an unexpected data risk.

twist.text: Some health apps sell anonymized data â€” but 'anonymized' health data can often be re-identified.

climax.text: Your health data is among the most sensitive and the least protected in the digital economy.

punchline.text: Your doctor keeps secrets. Your health app might not.

quiz.question: Why are fitness apps a health data risk?
options: They often aren't covered by medical privacy laws like HIPAA
